name: Mixed Bag 22 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [E] | 10 Questions

questions.text: The first bows and arrows were probably used by man during which age?
questions.explanation:
Stone.

	The start of the stone age varies. It is thought to have begun in Africa 2.5 million years ago, Asia 1.8 million years ago and Europe 1 million years ago.

questions.text: Which state is the largest producer of popcorn?
questions.explanation:
Nebraska.

	Popcorn is a variant of flint corn. Iowa also produces large amounts of it.

questions.text: In what year was the shower invented?
questions.explanation:
1850.

	The Bunsen gas burner was also invented in this year. California became a state and Zachary Taylor became our 13th president.

questions.text: What is Sri Lanka's former name?
questions.explanation:
Ceylon.

	It is an island republic off the coast of India.

questions.text: Who was the Russian premier during the Cuban Missile crisis?
questions.explanation:
Khrushchev.

	In 1962 he provoked the United States by sending Soviet nuclear missiles to Cuba.

questions.text: Which razor did tennis star John McEnroe endorse?
How long were Marilyn Monroe and Joe DiMaggio married?
questions.explanation:
9 months.

	They were married in 1954 but their marriage was short lived.

questions.text: Which part of the eye is stored in Eye Banks?
questions.explanation:
Cornea.

	Other parts of the eye that are used include the sclera (the white tissue) and the vitreous humor (the clear gel).

questions.text: Howard Hughes' 'Spruce Goose' has a wing span of how many feet?
questions.explanation:
320.

	It weighed over 170,000 pounds and actually flew over one mile. It now has a permanent home in McMinville, Oregon.

questions.text: In what country was Audrey Hepburn born?
questions.explanation:
Belgium.

	She was born in 1929 in Brussels. Her mother was a Dutch Baroness and her father was a British banker. She died in 1993.
